body.p:
Westliberty Ky Jany the 12th 1861
His Excellency Beriah Magoffin

Dear Sir at the last June term of the Morgan circuit court. I inflicted a fine of $20. on W, W, Cox sheriff of the county. (Some disorder having occured in court.) only to make him the more watchful of order & prompt him to pursue it. he being then a candidate I feared he would be from the circumstance intimidated from using that promptness usual with him in Keeping order. I intended at the time to remit the fine at the close of the court, but forgot it & adjourned, hence the fine stands against him, and I have no controll over it. I feel that he ought not to pay it, and therefore ask your excellency to remit it, if you under the circumstances, feel it would be compatable with your duty,

I am Dear Sir your obedient servant
Wm, H, Burns

Morgan Cir. Ct
Remitted
B. M
$20
W. W. Cox
Issd Jany 22d 1861
